title: Textbook of Adult Emergency Medicine
role_in_edaitutor: Clinical, pragmatic adult EM reference with strong Australasian influence, used for region-appropriate management suggestions.

chapters.chapter_title: Assessment and Risk Stratification in the ED
chapters.summary: Provides a clinically focused framework for assessing adults in the ED, including disposition and risk stratification tools relevant to Australasian practice.
Discusses ED diagnosis and management of chest pain and other cardiovascular presentations, with practical pathways and disposition criteria.
Covers common adult respiratory emergencies and emphasises practical ED management strategies and disposition decisions.
Focuses on adult neurological and psychiatric presentations, including ED evaluation and safe management of behavioural emergencies.
Addresses common abdominal and GU complaints, including red flag features and ED imaging and consultation thresholds.
Provides pragmatic guidance on infectious disease presentations, empiric therapy, and admission versus discharge decisions.
Summarises trauma assessment and early management in the ED, aligned with ATLS concepts and local trauma systems.
Covers practical management of musculoskeletal injuries and soft tissue conditions seen commonly in adult emergency practice.
Provides adult-focused toxicology and substance use guidance suitable for real-world ED practice.
Summarises adult endocrine and metabolic emergencies, with emphasis on practical ED stabilisation and monitoring.
Highlights adult emergency care considerations in special populations and vulnerable groups.
